prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message:
I love reading online articles about various topics that capture my interest. One area that always fascinates me is technology. I enjoy exploring articles that delve into the latest advancements, innovative gadgets, and upcoming trends. Learning about new technologies keeps me informed and excited about the possibilities of the digital world. 

For example, articles that discuss the latest smartphone features, cutting-edge AI apps, or breakthroughs in renewable energy technology grab my attention. They offer insights into the ever-evolving tech landscape.

Another type of online article I find enjoyable and helpful are how-to tutorials. These articles provide step-by-step instructions on accomplishing tasks or mastering skills. Whether it's learning to cook a new recipe, fixing a computer issue, or a DIY project, I find these tutorials informative and empowering. 

They enable me to acquire practical knowledge. When the articles include diagrams and photos, it becomes even easier to follow along and understand the process. Clear visuals enhance the learning experience.

In addition to technology-focused articles, I have a keen interest in opinion-based pieces about important topics like the economy and international affairs. Articles discussing economic policies, global trade, or geopolitical events provide me with a broader perspective on the world. 

Trusted news sources like The New York Times, BBC, and The Guardian often present well-researched articles that analyze these complex issues. Understanding different viewpoints and expert opinions helps me develop a more comprehensive understanding of the world around me.

Overall, I find that articles with diagrams and photos make the content more engaging and accessible, allowing me to grasp complex ideas more easily. 

Trustworthy sources are crucial for me to avoid misinformation and fake news, ensuring the articles I read are reliable and credible. 

By exploring articles covering technology, how-to tutorials, reviews, and opinion-based pieces, I can stay informed, expand my knowledge, and form well-rounded perspectives on various subjects.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: Want to read about the latest challenges that EV manufacturers are facing

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?
Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Bon Appetit
Title: Bon Appetit's Best Banana Bread Recipe
Description: After baking 14 loaves, we aligned on this tender, ultra-moist banana bread as our collective favorite.
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: National Geographic
Title: There’s a new way to tour the Amazon rainforest: by crane
Description: Canopy cranes, once reserved for treetop research, let you see the “eighth continent” like an arbornaut.
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Travel and Leisure
Title: These Airlines Have the Most Luxurious Economy Seats
Description: You can find good Champagne, amenity kits, hot towel service, and wider seats in the economy cabin — if you know where to look.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: This sounds like sponsored advertising and not an article to just read
